intro: Gustavia foliosa, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
